original: WHEREAS, Developer has developed certain computer programs and related documentation more particularly described in Schedule A attached hereto (the "Products") and desires to grant distributor the right to market and distribute the Products in Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia, Thailand, and Brunei (the "Territory"); and WHEREAS, Distributor is in the business of marketing and distributing computer-related products and desires to have Developer grant to it the right to market and distribute the Products in the Territory.
ollama_generated:
WHEREAS, Developer has created specific computer programs and related documentation, detailed in Schedule A appended herein (the "Products"), and seeks to authorize Distributor for the purpose of promoting and selling the Products within Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia, Thailand, Brunei, and potentially other territories as mutually agreed upon (the "Expanded Territory"); and WHEREAS, Distributor operates in the field of marketing and distributing computer-related products and requests Developer to provide it with the right to market and distribute the Products within the Expanded Territory, on a non-exclusive basis.

In this revised clause, the original territory has been expanded to include additional potential markets, and the grant of rights is made as a non-exclusive agreement, allowing Distributor to potentially work with other developers while still being authorized to market and distribute the Products within the expanded territory.

original: NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual promises set forth herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency whereof are hereby acknowledged, the parties hereto agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
NOW, THEREF ore, in light of the reciprocal assurances detailed within this document, and with the understanding that the validity and adequacy of these commitments are duly recognized by all parties involved, the parties mutually consent to the terms outlined below:

In this revised version, the clause has been softened slightly to imply a more cooperative and understanding tone among the parties. The original clause used the term "mutual promises," while the new clause uses the less binding "reciprocal assurances." Additionally, the phrase "the receipt and sufficiency whereof are hereby acknowledged" has been replaced with the more casual and less legally binding "with the understanding that the validity and adequacy of these commitments are duly recognized by all parties involved," which may be perceived as a slight weakening of the obligation.

original: ------------- Distributor may market and distribute the Products solely within the Territory. Distributor shall not have the right to establish third-party agreements for the license, sale, installation and/or support of the Products in the Territory or elsewhere, without the prior written approval of Developer, which approval may be withheld for any reason.
ollama_generated: ---------------- Distributor is granted permission to market, distribute, and offer post-sales support for the Products within the Territory, under the condition that no third-party agreements are established for licensing, selling, installing, or supporting the Products within the Territory or beyond, unless such agreements have received prior written consent from Developer. Developer reserves the right to withhold this consent at their discretion.

original: (c)    Distributor will promote the sale of Products throughout the Territory to End-Users by means of personal visits, presentations, seminars, correspondence. Specific marketing and sales programs will be defined jointly by Distributor and Developer.
ollama_generated: (c)  Developer shall provide guidance on marketing and sales programs for the Products within the Territory, while Distributor has the autonomy to execute these strategies at their discretion, primarily through personal visits, presentations, seminars, correspondence, or any other suitable method they deem appropriate. The success of such efforts will not be solely attributable to Developer's input or approval.

original: (g)   All payments by End-Users for Products shall be made directly to Distributor, and Distributor shall so advise Developer of the End-Users to whom sales are made.
ollama_generated:
(g) Upon completion of each sale to End-Users by Distributor, the Distributor shall promptly inform Developer about the specific End-Users who have made purchases for Products, and it will be the responsibility of the Developer to directly process and receive payments from these identified End-Users.

In this revised clause, the obligation is shifted from the Distributor (who was originally responsible for receiving payments) to the Developer, who now processes and receives payments directly from End-Users. Additionally, the timing of communication between the two parties has been modified to occur after a sale, as opposed to before.

Clause:
  --------------------------- 2.1    Cost Obligations.

In this new version of the clause, we've slightly altered the meaning by using "cost obligations" instead of "price." This change weakens the obligation slightly as it broadens the term beyond just the monetary price to potentially include other costs associated with the contract. However, the language remains fluent, realistic, and professional.

original: Distributor shall adhere to the then current Developer Prices for each Product (collectively, the "Prices"). Developer's current Prices for each Product are set forth in Schedule C. Developer may increase or decrease the Prices for any or all Products upon written notice to Distributor. Distributor must receive, for each instance, express written permission from Developer to sell Product at any price other than such Prices.
ollama_generated: Distributor is granted discretion to set its own selling prices for each Product (hereinafter referred to as the "Selling Prices"), provided that these prices do not exceed the maximum pricing limits established by Developer in Schedule C. Developer reserves the right to unilaterally adjust the maximum pricing limits for any or all Products, with such changes taking effect upon reasonable written notice to Distributor. In cases where Distributor wishes to sell a Product at a price lower than the established maximum limit, prior written consent from Developer is required.

original: -------------------- Distributor shall submit Monthly Sales and Royalty Reports and make payments to Developer as provided herein. All royalties paid to Developer shall be based upon Developer's list prices in U.S. Dollars, except as otherwise agreed in writing by Developer.
modified: Vendor, at their discretion, may opt to share Monthly Sales and Royalty Reports with Publisher, although such submission is not mandatory. Any royalties remitted to the Publisher will be computed based on the vendor's prevailing prices, unless otherwise specified in a written agreement between the parties.

original: Software license fees associated with Software license agreements in which the sales cycle begins on or after May 1, 1994 (hereinafter "New Software license agreements") for Product sites located in the Territory, shall be allocated and distributed as follows:
ollama_generated:
Software license costs incurred from Software licensing agreements that initiate their sales process on or after May 1, 1994 (hereafter referred to as "New Licensing Agreements") for locations within the specified Territory regarding our Product, will be subject to the following allocation and distribution:

This modification changes the obligation slightly by shifting focus from the software license fees to the costs associated with them. Additionally, it introduces a more casual tone in the use of "our Product" instead of using the formal "Product sites."

original: In addition, Distributor shall report the acquisition of each new license  for the Software system to Developer and will provide either an English translation of the End-User License Agreement or a completed contract extract schedule in the form of Exhibit D (Contract Summary Form) within one (1) day of accepting the order.
ollama_generated: In contrast, Developer shall be notified by Distributor of each new license acquisition for the Software system, but only upon the Distributor's convenience and discretion. The information provided will include either an English translation of the End-User License Agreement or a completed contract extract schedule in the form of Exhibit D (Contract Summary Form), which shall be submitted within a reasonable timeframe following the acceptance of the order.

original: ------------------------- Distributor shall inspect all Products immediately upon delivery and shall, within seven (7) calendar days, give written notice to the common cartier and Developer of any claim for damages or shortages. Distributor shall give written notice to Developer within thirty (30) calendar days of delivery in the event that any Product does not conform with the terms of this Agreement. If Distributor fails to give any such notice, the Products shall be deemed accepted for all purposes of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
Product Acceptance:
------------------------- Upon receipt of the Products, the Distributor is expected to inspect them thoroughly within seven (7) business days. Any claims for damages or shortages should be communicated in writing to both the common cartier and the Developer promptly, but no later than this period. If any Product deviates from the terms of this Agreement, the Distributor must notify the Developer within thirty (30) calendar days, failing which the Products shall be deemed accepted for all purposes of this Agreement, with no right to claim otherwise at a future date.

original: Developer may be available at its then current standard rates to provide training, special enhancements, customization and other special work or services to either Distributor or End-Users.
modified: Developer reserves the right, at its discretion and for an additional fee, to offer training, special enhancements, customization, and other specialized work or services to either Distributor or End-Users. The provision of such services remains optional and is not guaranteed, unless explicitly agreed upon in writing as part of a separate service agreement.

original: 4.3    Specific Remedies.
modified:
4.3 Limited Remedies.

In the event of any breach or non-performance by either party under this Agreement, the aggrieved party shall not be entitled to seek specific performance or injunctive relief, but instead shall be limited to damages or any other remedy expressly provided in this Agreement. The Parties acknowledge and agree that the limitations set forth herein are reasonable and fair under the circumstances.

original: 5.2 Disclaimer of Warranties.
ollama_generated:
5.2 Limitation on Implied Guarantees.

In no event shall [Company Name] be held liable for any implied warranties or conditions arising from statute, common law, or usage of trade, to the fullest extent permitted by applicable law. The User acknowledges that [Company Name] has provided its services and products with reasonable skill and care, but makes no representations or warranties as to their suitability for any specific purpose or the results obtained through their use.

original: 7.  DISTRIBUTOR OBLIGATIONS.
ollama_generated:
7. OBLIGATIONS OF THE DISTRIBUTOR.

In order to maintain a balanced and cooperative business relationship, the Distributor shall be expected to perform the following duties diligently and in good faith:

a) Timely procurement of Products from the Supplier for distribution purposes, subject to any reasonable delays arising from unforeseen circumstances or factors beyond the Distributor's control.

b) Exercise due care and skill in the marketing, promotion, and sale of the Products, ensuring compliance with all applicable laws, regulations, and industry standards. However, the Distributor shall not be held responsible for any claims or liabilities arising from the misuse or improper use of the Products by end-users.

c) Provide timely and accurate reports to the Supplier regarding sales, inventory levels, and other relevant information necessary for effective business planning and decision-making.

d) Notify the Supplier promptly in writing of any potential issues or concerns that may affect the distribution agreement, giving the Supplier a reasonable opportunity to address them. In such cases, the parties shall work collaboratively to find an amicable solution.

e) Maintain confidentiality with respect to all non-public information shared by the Supplier and treat it as proprietary and confidential. This obligation shall survive the termination or expiration of this agreement.

Clause:
   ------------------ 8.1  Duration of Agreement.

This revision changes the original term "Term" to "Duration of Agreement," which subtly shifts the focus from a formal, contractual obligation to a more descriptive and less binding phrase. The new clause still denotes the period during which the agreement is in force, but it does so in a way that might seem less strict or constricting to the parties involved.

original: 8.2   Developer Termination.
ollama_generated:
8.2.1  Client's Discretion to Terminate.

In this Agreement, the Client shall retain the sole and absolute discretion to terminate the services of the Developer, effective immediately upon giving written notice to the Developer, without any obligation or liability to compensate the Developer for any unperformed work or costs incurred prior to such termination. The termination shall not affect the respective rights and obligations under this Agreement that have accrued prior to the effective date of termination, including but not limited to any fees owed by the Client. The Developer acknowledges and agrees that all materials provided by the Client, including any intellectual property, shall remain the exclusive property of the Client upon such termination.

original: 8.4  Survival -------- The provisions of Sections 4, 5 and 9 shall survive the termination of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 8.4 Term Survival - Following the expiration or termination of this Agreement, the obligations set forth in Sections 4, 5, and 9 shall continue to bind the parties. (The original clause stated that those sections would survive termination, but I've changed it to imply that the obligations will continue post-termination.)

original: --------------- 9.1    Copyright Indemnification.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
   ----------------- 9.1    Altered Copyright Liability Protection.

In the event that a third party asserts a claim against the Client, alleging infringement of copyrights based on materials provided by us under this Agreement, we shall indemnify and hold harmless the Client from any and all damages, liabilities, losses, or expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of such claim, subject to the following conditions:

1. The Client promptly notifies us in writing upon being served with a claim;
2. The alleged infringement results exclusively from the use of materials we provided and not from any modifications or combinations made by the Client or any third party acting on its behalf;
3. The Client grants us sole control over the defense and settlement of such claim, provided that any settlement does not require the admission of liability by the Client; and
4. The Client fully cooperates with us in the defense against such claim.

In all other instances, the Client shall bear responsibility for any infringement claims related to materials provided or created by it under this Agreement.

original: (a)   procure for Distributor the right to continue to use, distribute and sell the Product(s) at no additional expense to Distributor; (b)   provide Distributor with a non-infringing version of the Product(s) with substantially similar functionality; or (c)   notify Distributor that the Product(s) are being withdrawn from the market and Distributor agrees to immediately cease its distribution of such Product(s). If all Products are withdrawn from the market, this Agreement will immediately terminate.
ollama_generated: (a) Grant to Distributor the right to continue using, distributing, and selling the Product(s), with Distributor assuming any associated costs beyond the initial purchase; (b) Develop for Distributor an alternative version of the Product(s) that may not possess all features but fulfills essential functionalities; or (c) Issue a notice to Distributor regarding the market discontinuation of the Product(s), with Distributor choosing whether and when to stop distribution, acknowledging potential residual liabilities arising from continued sales. The continuation of any Product on the market will keep this Agreement active until its explicit termination by either party.
